command.name: connect
command.desc: Tell stellard to try to connect to some other peer.

argument.name: ip
argument.desc: The IP or domain name to try to connect to.

command.name: ledger_accept
command.desc: ledger_accept is only used for testing. If stellard is started with -a then the ledger won't close until stellard receives this command.

command.name: logrotate
command.desc: Rotate the log file. This closes and re-opens the file. Typically this is used with a cron job or a manual command line process to first move the existing log file before calling logrotate so that the new log file starts out empty again.

command.name: log_level
command.desc:
Sets the log level of how much information should be shown. Pick from the following:
  • trace
  • debug
  • info
  • warning
  • error
  • fatal

command.name: peers
command.desc: Gets a list of peers this server is connected to.

command.name: server_info
command.desc: Returns various information about this server.

command.name: unl_add
command.desc: Adds an entry to this server's UNL.

command.name: unl_delete
command.desc: Remove an entry from this server's UNL.

result.name: comment
result.desc: A comment associated with the publicKey.

command.name: unl_load
command.desc: Reload the UNL from the config file.

command.name: validation_create
command.desc: Generate a random public private key pair to use for a stellard validator.

result.name: validation_public_key
result.desc: Validation public key, base58 encoded. Give this to other stellard operators so they can add your server to their UNL.

result.name: validation_seed
result.desc: Validation secret key, base58 encoded. Put in your stellard.cfg if you want this to be a validating server.
